“I was so happy to interest you in my opinions,” he said.  

“You are very pale, Avdotya Romanovna.”  

“I know his theory. I read that article about men to whom all is permitted.”  

“Mr. Razumihin? Your brother’s article? Is there such an article?”  

“I want to see Sofya Semyonovna. How do I go to her?”  

“Ah, then you are lying! I see … you were lying … lying all the time.”  

Dounia sank into a chair.  

“Control yourself! Here is some water. Drink a little.”  

She shuddered.  

“Calm yourself! Believe me, he has friends. We will save him.”  

“Would you like me to take him abroad? I have money.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Avdotya Romanovna is distressed and desperate to see Sofya Semyonovna, believing she may have important news.
